subject: Web3
title: Discord and Telegram Scams
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Discord and Telegram Scams.

hook.text: Crypto communities live on Discord and Telegram. Scammers exploit this by impersonating admins and posting fake links.

buildup.text: Fake mint links, phishing bots, and compromised admin accounts are used to trick thousands of users at once.

discovery.text: In 2022, the Bored Ape Yacht Club Discord was hacked. Members clicked a fake airdrop link and lost $360,000 in NFTs.

twist.text: Scammers create DMs that look identical to official announcements. Even skeptical users get fooled under time pressure.

climax.text: Community platforms designed for trust became the primary attack surface. Socializing and security are at odds.

punchline.text: The communities built for trust became the easiest places to scam.

quiz.question: How was the Bored Ape Yacht Club Discord exploited?
options: The admin account was hacked and a fake airdrop link was posted
